page.title: 17HIGH HALL
page.content: {High Hall}is situated on a hill in Stanbridge. It has been in the Gibsons' family since it was built (1680-1690). The land owned around the house is 500 acres, Mrs Gibson lets 250 acres to each of the two farmers for farming. Private fishing amd boating takes place; the money from these helps to keep the house. There are thirty-two rooms in the house, but only half the house is used. Living in the house are the owner, her two children, the lodger, and the modern part of the building is let to a family. The owner leads a peaceful and simple home life. She takes her daughter to private school every morning. Her hobbies are gardening and listening to music. The owner employs a housekeeper who comes once a week, and a gardener.
